messages.messageBody:
Bridget,

may I compliment you on all getting along living together, but suggest that
perhaps the fact that you all loved each other in some way (parent-child,
romantic relationship, whatever) before you became 5 different religions may
have some bearing on that?

My impression is that many of the problems in the world relate to the fact
that people do NOT know and love each other as anything other than historic
opponents. When relationships are built, as a christian school in Jerusalem
is trying to do with children from all 3 major faith groups, then people
have a foundation on which to build.

brenda

> Because we have FIVE distinctly different religions represented here,
> yet we all manage to live together.
>
> So actually, it related to Ireland better, because that is a religion
> thing more than the Palestine/Isreal thing which is beyond religion
> and into land grabbing and politics.
>
> Bridget
